name: Yau's conjecture
rephrased: Any closed three-dimensional shape with a specific geometric structure (a Riemannian metric) must contain infinitely many surfaces that are locally minimal, like soap films without gravity.
implication_form: If a Riemannian 3-manifold is closed, then it has infinitely many minimal surfaces.
explained: Yau's conjecture states that any closed Riemannian 3-manifold admits infinitely many distinct smooth closed immersed minimal surfaces.
related_conjectures: Calabi conjecture, Poincaré conjecture, Yang-Mills existence and mass gap conjecture, Bénilan's leafwise homotopy theory
